# Jam.dev

## Documentation

- [Welcome to Jam](/docs/get-started/welcome-to-jam.md)

- [Creating a Jam](/docs/get-started/creating-a-jam.md): Learn how to capture issues by yourself
- [Team Setup and Integrations](/docs/get-started/team-setup-and-integrations.md): Learn how to invite your team and connect your tools
- [Recording Links](/docs/request-a-jam/recording-links.md): Recording Links eliminate the guesswork in bug reports. Send anyone a link; they click, record their issue, and you get a complete technical reproductionâ€”no installations required.
- [How to Use Recording Links](/docs/request-a-jam/recording-links/how-to-use-recording-links.md)
- [Setting up Recording Links with console logs, network requests](/docs/request-a-jam/recording-links/setting-up-recording-links-with-console-logs-network-requests.md): Send a link to auto-capture console logs, network requests and more. Just connect your website to Jam. Here's how.
- [Jam for Customer Support](/docs/request-a-jam/jam-for-customer-support.md): Jam for Customer Support helps your team solve customer issues faster.
- [Getting started with Jam.js](/docs/request-a-jam/jam-for-customer-support/getting-started-with-jam.js.md): Install Jam.js to get console logs, network requests, and more, in every customer support ticket.
